channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Car with no MOT dumped on public road, 16th November
item.description:
Car hasn’t moved for weeks and has a month expired MOT. This is a spot notorious for people dumping cars so should be investigated. As depicted car hasn’t had valid MOT for over a month. Photos taken and MOT checked 16th November 2025.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Keeble Close, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 wheelie bins placed on street to restrict parking, 16th November
item.description:
Resident is placing three of their wheelie bins in the parking to prevent parking in the parking bays. The bays permit to anyone on Sundays and they are placing the wheelie bins to restrict parking. Then when you try to move the bins, they come outside to verbally accost you, shout and swear.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pincott Road, Bexley, Bexleyheath, London Borough of Bexley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bike repair stand tips over, 16th November
item.description:
The bike repair stand near dollis valley greenwalk (by Whetstone Tube), isn't properly anchored to the ground. Hanging a bike on it causes it to tip the bike off. The tools were still very useful, and helped me fix my bike and get home.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dollis Valley Greenwalk, Whetstone, Chipping Barnet, London Borough of Barnet
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Somone has turned the light around so two ways go green, 16th November
item.description:
IF you are coming from crystal palace towards birkbeck the light on the right that should point down the side road has been turned to point up towards CP. Mean people go at the same time. Near miss with a motorbike Please treat as urgent
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Anerley Road, Anerley, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Damage - pole leaning / equipment detached from pole/facing the wrong direction

item.title: Outside 227 Kilburn Lane, 16th November
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn Lane, North Kensington, London

item.title: Grass damage getting worse, 16th November
item.description:
The area of grass on Croydon Road Rec that was damaged by the Soul Town Festival is getting worse and more widespread possibly by council vehicles using that corner of grass as a short cut. Please advise what are the plans for repairing this area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Whitmore Road, Beckenham, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned bike for last 3 years!, 16th November
item.description:
This bike has been there since I moved here... It's a hazard and should be removed by the council immediately!

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Weymouth Terrace, Hackney, London

item.title: Rubbish being dumped outside bin store, 16th November
item.description:
The rubbish chute is broken and people are dumping their rubbish outside the bin store - too lazy to walk to the nearest bin! The chute has been stuffed with rubbish there's a blockage somewhere... this has gone on for over weeks now please can you fix.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Weymouth Terrace, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Big pile of poo in lift, 16th November
item.description:
Someone has done a big poo in the lifts - needs cleaning ASAP. Especially important due to anyone with mobility issues or children being unable to use lift and constant presence of drug users in the staircase.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Street, Old Kent Road, London Borough of Southwark
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lovel Avenue, East Wickham, London Borough of Bexley

item.title: Chair outside my kitchen window. Other articles lined against building causing havoc to binmen trying to remove, empty and return huge metal bins., 16th November
item.description:
I'm housebound. However I've seen the difficulty the binmen have trying to maneuver around obstructions from my kitchen window. Ive not seen those responsible. My daughter says there's also a large planter ith "tree" still in it
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Soiled Nappies, 16th November
item.description:
Male person living at 64 Village Way keeps placing soiled baby nappies from his house into the street bin outside 60 Village Way right next to a bus stop. This person should be placing these dirty nappies in his own dustbin and not the public one. Why should the public have to stand by a bus stop smelling dirty nappies from number 64.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 64, Village Way, Beckenham, London Borough of Bromley
Report on FixMyStreet
